messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
No.
What is the address?
Sorry, 763 South, 475 East.
Okay, what's going on?
Um, we have somebody, sorry.
Okay, do you need an ambulance?
Um, my, okay, hold on just one second.
We got robbed, and we were cooperating with the guy, and my husband was finally able to get to his gun and shot him.
Okay.
Avonable units respond to 763 South, 475 East, possible home invasion, weapons involved, one shot fired.
Can you tell me where the suspect is?
He's in our bedroom.
Is he breathing?
He's dead. He's dead. My husband is taking the bullets out of the gun.
Okay. I'd like him just to set it down and take a deep breath. Is there only one suspect?
Only one that I know of.
Do you know the individual?
No. I woke up to him in our room.
Okay, ma'am?
Yes.
Alright. Does anybody need an ambulance other than the person that was shot?
No. You and your husband are okay?
Yes, we're okay.
Are there any other suspects that you're concerned about in your home?
Not that I know of. He came in alone?
Yes. He came in alone as far as we know.
And you don't know who he is or anything about him?
No.
Okay, I'd like you to put the gun somewhere obvious to the officer. It's on the table.
Okay, I think my husband went to the bathroom, but it's on the table. I can see it, and I'm standing by the front door unlocked.
Alright. The gun holder has taken the bullets out and set the gun on the table. Please step away from the weapon.
I'm going to keep you on the phone just to make sure that you're safe, okay?
Okay, honey, don't touch anything. Don't touch anything and don't touch him.
Are you certain he is deceased?
Yes, I am positive he is deceased. My husband checked his pulse.
Okay, alright. Just keep away from him just in case, okay?
He's upstairs right now.
Did that person have a weapon, too?
He said he did, but we never saw one.
Okay. I have officers there. I want you to unlock your door.
We're right here by the front door. It's unlocked.
Okay, open your door. You should have an officer there.
Yes, right here.
Okay, I'm going to let you go. They're going to take over from here, okay?
Okay, thank you.
Bye-bye.
Bye.
